feed.title: Google Cloud: Dataflow
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Dataflow

entry.content:
Dataflow now supports an automated parallel update workflow for streaming jobs. This feature helps minimize disruption by launching a new replacement job that runs in parallel with the existing job. After a duration of time you specify, the old job is automatically drained.
For more information, see [Run parallel pipelines](https://cloud.google.com/dataflow/docs/guides/upgrade-guide#run-parallel-pipelines).
entry.summary: Dataflow now supports an automated parallel update workflow for streaming jobs. This feature helps minimize disruption by launching a new replacement job that runs in parallel with the existing job. After a duration of time you specify, the old job is automatically drained.
entry.title: Feature: Automated parallel update workflow for streaming jobs

entry.content: Dataflow now supports right fitting for streaming jobs. *Right fitting* lets you specify resource requirements for an entire pipeline or for specific pipeline steps. Previously, right fitting was only supported for batch pipelines. For more information, see [Streaming right fitting](https://cloud.google.com/dataflow/docs/guides/right-fitting#streaming-right-fitting).
entry.summary: Dataflow now supports right fitting for streaming jobs, allowing you to specify resource requirements for your entire pipeline or specific steps. This feature was previously only available for batch pipelines.
entry.title: Feature: Dataflow now supports right fitting for streaming jobs
